p: In patients with COVID-19, the serum level of ferritin was significantly elevated in non-survivors compared with survivors during the clinical stages of the disease, and raised with case deterioration. 5 Shoenfeldreported that the H-chain of the ferritin had a role in activating macrophages to raise the secretion of inflammatory cytokines. So, understanding of the pathogenesis of the hyperferritinemic syndrome including the infection with COVID-19 became obvious. 36
